Line 954 uses the same regularUser1 to GRANT permission to regularUser2. Shouldn't they be consistent? (And shouldn't a User who has the right to grant a permission also have the right to revoke it?)

Please review @gjacoby126 @twdsilva

This change has some broader implications -- PTableType is used in JDBC metadata API queries, and changing the PTableType from TABLE to INDEX would mean that the view index table would show up as an index in calls to DatabaseMetadata.getIndexInfo(), or DatabaseMetadata.getTables() that filters on INDEX type. 

But it's not _really_ an index, just a physical container in which other indexes may or may not live. Really, they should be their own PTableType, but because the enum's used on both client and server side, adding an enum value would be really tricky. 

This is also why this small change caused a good number of test failures.

Thank you @gjacoby126 and @kadirozde. Yes, I have been investigating the test failures. Was able to find the root cause as all failed tests had an immutable base table and the same point of failure in case of view indexes. working on a better approach to tackle this problem.
